title: socks5: Invalid buffer content on short send
body:
### I did this

@realyukii intercepts the sendto syscall to simulate short send, but
curl incorrectly handles it. It keeps resending the version:
```
[reyuki@zero curl]$   strace -x -e trace=%net curl -s -x socks5h://lorem:ipsum@[::1]:1080 google.com
socket(AF_INET6, SOCK_STREAM|SOCK_NONBLOCK, IPPROTO_TCP) = 4
setsockopt(4, SOL_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, [1], 4) = 0
setsockopt(4, SOL_SOCKET, SO_KEEPALIVE, [1], 4) = 0
setsockopt(4, SOL_TCP, TCP_KEEPIDLE, [60], 4) = 0
setsockopt(4, SOL_TCP, TCP_KEEPINTVL, [60], 4) = 0
setsockopt(4, SOL_TCP, TCP_KEEPCNT, [9], 4) = 0
connect(4, {sa_family=AF_INET6, sin6_port=htons(1080), sin6_flowinfo=htonl(0), inet_pton(AF_INET6, "::1", &sin6_addr), sin6_scope_id=0}, 28) = -1 EINPROGRESS (Operation now in progress)
getsockname(4, {sa_family=AF_INET6, sin6_port=htons(48848), sin6_flowinfo=htonl(0), inet_pton(AF_INET6, "::1", &sin6_addr), sin6_scope_id=0}, [128 => 28]) = 0
getsockopt(4, SOL_SOCKET, SO_ERROR, [0], [4]) = 0
getsockname(4, {sa_family=AF_INET6, sin6_port=htons(48848), sin6_flowinfo=htonl(0), inet_pton(AF_INET6, "::1", &sin6_addr), sin6_scope_id=0}, [128 => 28]) = 0
sendto(4, "\x05", 1, MSG_NOSIGNAL, NULL, 0) = 1
sendto(4, "\x05", 1, MSG_NOSIGNAL, NULL, 0) = 1
sendto(4, "\x05", 1, MSG_NOSIGNAL, NULL, 0) = 1
sendto(4, "\x05", 1, MSG_NOSIGNAL, NULL, 0) = 1
sendto(4, "\x05", 1, MSG_NOSIGNAL, NULL, 0) = 1
sendto(4, "\x05", 1, MSG_NOSIGNAL, NULL, 0) = 1
sendto(4, "\x05", 1, MSG_NOSIGNAL, NULL, 0) = 1
sendto(4, "\x05", 1, MSG_NOSIGNAL, NULL, 0) = 1
sendto(4, "\x05", 1, MSG_NOSIGNAL, NULL, 0) = 1
sendto(4, "\x05", 1, MSG_NOSIGNAL, NULL, 0) = 1
sendto(4, "\x05", 1, MSG_NOSIGNAL, NULL, 0) = -1 EPIPE (Broken pipe)
+++ exited with 97 +++
```

### I expected the following

It should continue sending the next bytes instead of repeatedly sending the version.

### curl/libcurl version

$  curl --version
curl 8.14.1 (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/8.14.1 OpenSSL/3.5.0 zlib/1.3.1.zlib-ng brotli/1.1.0 zstd/1.5.7 libidn2/2.3.7 libpsl/0.21.5 libssh2/1.11.1 nghttp2/1.66.0 nghttp3/1.10.1
Release-Date: 2025-06-04
Protocols: dict file ftp ftps gopher gophers http https imap imaps ipfs ipns mqtt pop3 pop3s rtsp scp sftp smb smbs smtp smtps telnet tftp ws wss
Features: alt-svc AsynchDNS brotli GSS-API HSTS HTTP2 HTTP3 HTTPS-proxy IDN IPv6 Kerberos Largefile libz NTLM PSL SPNEGO SSL threadsafe TLS-SRP UnixSockets zstd

### operating system

OS is irrelevant.
